Package it.polimi.ingsw.server.model

Class Board

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.server.model.Board
All Implemented Interfaces:
Jsonable
public class Board extends Object implements Jsonable
Represents one player's game area. It includes the School board, the assistants deck and the coins the player has. It also contains a reference to the player who owns the Board. All possible operations return a new Board instance, representing the new state of the player's game area.
See Also:
  • Assistant
  • BoundedStudentContainer
  • Hall
  • Tower
  • Player

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      Board (Player playerOwner, int entranceSize, int numTowers, TowerColor color) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Board constructor. Initializes all parameters and fills out the towers.
      Parameters:
      playerOwner - the player who owns the Board
      entranceSize - size of the entrance
      numTowers - the initial number of towers of the player
      color - the color of the towers
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if numTowers <= 0 || entranceSize <= 0

    • Board

      Board (Board oldBoard) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Constructor that creates a copy of a Board instance passed.
      Parameters:
      oldBoard - the old Board instance to copy
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the old Board is null

  • Method Details

    • playAssistant

      Board playAssistant (AssistantType type) throws IllegalArgumentException, NoSuchElementException
      Pops the given Assistant from the deck and plays it, placing it as lastPlayedAssistant. Returns a new Board instance, which hasn't got that assistant in the deck anymore.
      Parameters:
      type - the AssistantType of the assistant to play
      Returns:
      the new Board instance
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the assistant passed is null
      NoSuchElementException - if there isn't such assistant in the player's deck

    • receiveDeck

      Board receiveDeck (Mage mage, List<Assistant> assistantDeck) throws IllegalArgumentException, IllegalStateException
      Creates another Player instance with the specified deck of Assistants, and it returns the new Player.
      Parameters:
      mage - the Mage of the deck
      assistantDeck - the given deck of assistants
      Returns:
      the new Player instance
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if deckAdded == true (can't add a new deck if one is already present)
      IllegalArgumentException - if assistants == null

    • getPlayer

      Player getPlayer()
      Player getter.
      Returns:
      the player who owns this board

    • getLastPlayedAssistant

      public Optional<Assistant> getLastPlayedAssistant()
      lastPlayedAssistant getter.
      Returns:
      an Optional of Assistant (because initially lastPlayedAssistant could be null)

    • getAssistants

      List<Assistant> getAssistants()
      Returns the deck of assistants.
      Returns:
      a copy of assistants

    • sendTower

      Tuple<Board,Tower> sendTower() throws IllegalArgumentException, NoTowersException
      The player sends a Tower away to a Consumer<Tower>, if he has at least one inside towers. This method then returns another Board instance with the updated internal state.
      Returns:
      the new Board instance
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if towers is empty
      IllegalArgumentException - if the Consumer passed is null
      NoTowersException

    • receiveTower

      Board receiveTower (Tower t) throws IllegalArgumentException
      The player receives one Tower. The method then returns another Board instance, containing that tower.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if tower == null
      IllegalArgumentException - if tower's color is incorrect
      IllegalStateException - if towers is full

    • getNumOfTowers

      int getNumOfTowers()
      Getter for the number of towers held by player.
      Returns:
      the number of towers held by the player

    • getTowersColor

      TowerColor getTowersColor()
      Getter for the color of the towers held by the player.
      Returns:
      the TowerColor of the towers held by the player

    • updateHall

      Board updateHall (Function<Hall,Hall> update) throws IllegalArgumentException
      This method applies an update to the player's hall, which is expressed via a Function<Hall, Hall>, passed via parameter. This method then returns a copy of the original Board instance, with the applied update. If the update returns null, the update is aborted.
      Parameters:
      update - the function to apply
      Returns:
      the new Board instance
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the function passed is null

    • updateEntrance

      Board updateEntrance (Function<BoundedStudentContainer,BoundedStudentContainer> update) throws IllegalArgumentException
      This method applies an update to the player's entrance, which is expressed via a Function<BoundedContainer, BoundedContainer>, passed via parameter. This method then returns a copy of the original Board instance, with the applied update. If the update returns null, the update is aborted.
      Parameters:
      update - the function to apply
      Returns:
      the new Board instance
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the function passed is null

      public int getCoins()
      Returns the number of coins on this Board
      Returns:
      the number of coins on this Board

    • spendCoins

      Board spendCoins (int numCoins) throws IllegalArgumentException, NotEnoughCoinsException
      The player spends num_coins coins. This method then returns a new Board instance with the updated internal state
      Parameters:
      numCoins - the number of coins to be spent
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if numCoins <= 0
      IllegalStateException - if coins - numCoins <= 0 (the player tries to spend coins it doesn't have)
      NotEnoughCoinsException

    • receiveCoin

      Board receiveCoin() throws IllegalArgumentException
      The player receives one coin. A new Board instance with the updated internal state is then returned.
      Returns:
      the new Board instance
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException

    • getAssistant

      private Assistant getAssistant (AssistantType type) throws NoSuchElementException
      Helper method that gets the assistant corresponding to a certain AssistantType passed via parameter, if present in the player's deck. If not, it returns an exception.
      Parameters:
      type - the AssistantType of the assistant
      Returns:
      the corresponding Assistant of the player's deck, if present
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - if the player does not have the specified Assistant
